itemDescription: British racing cyclist, competitor for France

wikipedia_page.main: Lloyd Augustin Biden Hildebrand (25 December 1870 (Tottenham, United Kingdom) - 1 April 1924 (Levallois-Perret, France) was a British racing cyclist who competed in the late 19th century and early 20th century. He lived in France and married a French woman. He participated in cycling at the 1900 Summer Olympics in Paris, winning the silver medal in the men's 25 kilometre race.
